data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you will always face forward and you will always be pointing the same direction as you began. If you walk along a straight line, you will always take straight lines. When you walk along on a straight line, you will always have to face forward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The two sentences above are a combination. If you turn right after taking 4 steps, you take 4 steps and turn around. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow instructions, you would not travel back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left is to the right. So, it would be correct as you only took 7 steps of turning left. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the same as the turning point since both of them start with 10 steps from the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you are in reverse, the direction of the direction you were going in goes back 180 degrees so its safe to say you are in the starting position. So, the answer is No.

To turn right, you take 8 steps first, then 9 steps once you turn right. So, the answer is No.

If you return to the starting point, the first number of steps are 6, if you turn around, you take 8. The final answer: no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can often return to the starting point. One cannot always return to the beginning point if one is facing forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 9 steps take and two steps turn around. Then there are 3 steps and two steps turn around. Then there are 8 steps take and two steps turn around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person can be facing either forward or backward. If you always face forward, then one can take 3 steps in every direction but turn around. If one takes 3 steps forward and 1 step backwards, then one does 2 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 6 steps backward gives you the start point. The first step is the same as facing forward. The next step is to take 8 steps right, then 5 steps left, then 2 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take your original steps to the left until the next instruction says to face forward. Take 9 steps left and 10 steps left, taking 9 and 5 steps forward. To return to the starting point, you will face forward once again. If you have previously taken 9 steps left and 10, you must take 9. The answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow these instructions, you always face forward. You are in danger of coming under the wrong direction you were facing if you do not know how to do it. So, the answer is yes.

You can always face forward. Take 3 steps right and 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward and 3 steps right. Then take 3 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

You get a direction from right to left. You can' t get something back to get somewhere else. So, the answer is No.

Take 9 steps and then take 10 steps. Take 3 steps and then take 6 steps. So, the answer is No.

One takes 5 steps to return to a starting point. One takes 7 steps to return to a starting point. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step and take one step is a repeating sequence of taking 1 step, taking 1 step and taking 3 steps, 3 steps to return to the starting point. Twice one is a second is a third. So, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is facing 1st down. The starting point is the first step forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You can take 6 steps left to return to the starting point. It is possible to return to the starting point and still be facing toward your opposite direction. So, the answer is yes.

Turning right results in turning around. Turning right results in turning around. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you are going back to the beginning you would take 10 steps. The final answer: Yes.

Just because the starting point doesn’t matter does not mean there isn’t a way to get there. So, the answer is yes.

If you are facing forward and you complete the steps, you will get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around can be done in a number of ways. You can take any number of turns. It means that in addition to the first move, they are doing a series of three steps. So, yes.

If you always face forward, you go back to the starting point. Taking 5 steps backward leads to your starting point. Taking 4 steps backward leads to your starting point. Taking 9 steps forward leads to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

You cannot step left and backward. You cannot go right and left. Just like going from one side of a circle to the other, you cannot walk backwards. So, the answer is no.

If you are facing forward, all of your steps should be forward. So, the answer is yes.

For each step in the process, the directions take away only two steps. Taking 2 steps is a single step. For every two steps you take in the process of doing this, you take one step. So, the answer is Yes.

You should take 10 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Your forward motion means that you continue to move forward and the amount of steps you take indicates how many steps you will take, as per the first sentence. The third sentence is a rephrasing of the first sentence: Your rightward movement means to stay in alignment with (a). When you take 8 steps to the right, you go to (b). When you take 10 steps backward, you go to (c). When you take 4 steps left, you go to (d). The first sentence starts out opposite where it was left off, so you take 7 steps left, take 8 steps right, 8 steps left again, and 4 steps left. From this point, you will be moving in your opposite direction, in the opposite direction shown in the second sentence. If you are always facing forward, you can also take 8 steps backward. You can always turn around so you are facing forward as you begin your backward motion. So, the answer is yes.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
They are the same sequence of 7 distinct steps. They come together to solve a problem. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you reverse the direction you are facing, you would go back to the starting point. The instructions are not intended to tell you what to do, but to show how you would achieve a desired outcome. So, the answer is No.

Turning left is the same as turning right. Turning right is the same as turning left. So, the answer is No.

You can turn back 2 steps. The other way is to turn clockwise, and go forward. There are 4 steps to take left and 5 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

The number of steps required to return to your starting point is 1, 2, 3, 4. You may also take 10 steps forward. If you take 7 steps backward, you will return to the starting point. Therefore, the answer is yes.

You must always bear forward. If you face forward, you must always have your body facing forward. As you take steps backward, you are compelled to look at it in a different direction. As you take steps forward, you are compelled to look at it in a different direction. So, the answer is yes.
